about.summary: This package contains various tools for working with and evaluating cross-validated area under the ROC curve (AUC) estimators.  The primary functions of the package are ci.cvAUC and ci.pooled.cvAUC, which report cross-validated AUC and compute confidence intervals for cross-validated AUC estimates based on influence curves for i.i.d. and pooled repeated measures data, respectively.  One benefit to using influence curve based confidence intervals is that they require much less computation time than bootstrapping methods.  The utility functions, AUC and cvAUC, are simple wrappers for functions from the ROCR package.

name: r-cvauc
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.1.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-cvauc
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: cvAUC_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/cvAUC_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/cvAUC/cvAUC_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c4d8ed53b93869650aa2f666cf6d1076980cbfea7fa41f0b8227595be849738d

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1002
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rocr
    - r-data.table
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rocr
    - r-data.table

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('cvAUC')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('cvAUC')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ledell/cvAUC
  license: Apache-2-0
  summary: 'This package contains various tools for working with and evaluating cross-validated
    area under the ROC curve (AUC) estimators.  The primary functions of the package
    are ci.cvAUC and ci.pooled.cvAUC, which report cross-validated AUC and compute confidence
    intervals for cross-validated AUC estimates based on influence curves for i.i.d.
    and pooled repeated measures data, respectively.  One benefit to using influence
    curve based confidence intervals is that they require much less computation time
    than bootstrapping methods.  The utility functions, AUC and cvAUC, are simple wrappers
    for functions from the ROCR package. '
  license_family: APACHE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
